lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now from our own studio!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's so weird!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know, not a whole lot has changed at the moment. A few things, a few little bells and whistles here. But yeah, we're at our own place, which is crazy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is a crazy thing above us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know why.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just keep saying Fidelio.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Fidelio.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Before we jump into tonight's game, let's get through our announcements. First and foremost, our fantastic sponsor for this evening, and has been for quite some time, our friends at D&D Beyond!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: D&D Beyond!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sam, if you want to take that away.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We are terrible, but our bad luck is the kids' good fortune. The main thing that people have been wondering and talking about on The Facebooks and stuff is the new baby. Travis and Laura aren't here, you guys might have noticed, and everyone's like, "How was the birth? How did it all go down "two Thursdays ago?" So I have taken a little license, but I have scripted a bit of a radio play that we're all going to participate in to show our viewers how it all went down two Thursdays ago, and how the birth came to be. Taliesin will be narrating, I will be playing the role of Travis, Marisha will be playing the role of Laura.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, Laura.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Liam will be the doctor.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A real job, Dad!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And Matt will be a couple of different roles, including Matt Mercer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, I can probably do that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going to see what happens, this is a first performance of its kind. Take it away, Taliesin.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Exactly two weeks ago, at the Willingham house.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Babe, can you bring me some onion rings and Miller Ice with lime? The Cowboys game starts in six weeks and I want to be ready.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Our boy, the magical light that will illuminate the universe, will join us soon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Huh, what?! Right now?! But the Cowboys!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Travis, dear, your stallion is galloping to earth, humanity must welcome him with loving arms.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ugh, I'll get the stupid hospital bag.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Later, in the hospital waiting room.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, Matt, heads up, Laura's having that stupid baby.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh yeah, no problem, I'll just throw out the next three weeks of story I planned out and totally rework everything to accommodate this. I don't need to sleep. Ever.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Cool, bro. Hey, can you also tape the Dallas Cowboys game for me?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Meanwhile, inside the delivery room.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, Mrs. Willingham.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's Bailey.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh right, sorry. Anyway, I have checked your charts and you should be in a lot of pain right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel nothing but the sweet nectar of Mother Nature coursing through me. My love radiates like luminescent rainbows that will create a new life this day.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Really? Well, you should get ready for a long labor, this one could take up to 36 hours--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (infant crying)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The mortal world has received its divine cherub.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What?! That's medically impossible! You didn't even push!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does one need push for the summer to shine down its radiance upon us? No, we merely bask in its glory. Lo, my baby is perfection.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, I am perfection. Mother, I bring news from the womb. The newly revamped digital character sheet from D&D Beyond has released! What's been added: improved desktop and tablet views, better at a glance information, additional ad hoc customization, custom themes, shareable links, and an updated PDF export. To celebrate, D&D Beyond is giving away a complete legendary bundle to a random viewer. To enter to win, go to Twitter.com/DnDBeyond ('n', not '&'), and reply to the pinned tweet with a shareable link for one of your D&D Beyond characters. The giveaway ends this Sunday at midnight PM.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You are a miracle baby. I love you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I love you, Mama Willingham.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's Bailey.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And scene.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you guys, this was great. That was theater!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And strangely accurate.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was handed to us two minutes ago.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You were fantastic as Laura Bailey.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was like Travis was here!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, my Travis is pretty good. Also from D&D Beyond, next Wednesday, July 18 at 1:00 PM Pacific, & BEYOND, a new weekly stream hosted by Adam Bradford and Todd Kenreck, kicks off with super-special guest Matthew Mercer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you know that? Okay, cool. Each week, the show will cover not only D&D, but also the guest's other passions outside of D&D, like D&D.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Maybe they shouldn't have started with me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shenanigans will ensue, so don't miss it. Be sure to check it out at Twitch.tv/dndbeyond to watch. That's our sponsor shoutout.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Boom! Well done, Sam. Laura and Travis, direct all that fury at Sam, please.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Send your emails.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Sam. A couple of quick notes here: we are headed to San Diego Comic-Con next week for our Critical Role panel and, as we announced today, we're also going to New York Comic-Con later this year. For details on either of those events, go to Critrole.com for all the information. It's there for you. The "Nott the Best Detective Agency" shirt is up in the store right now. Once again, head to shop.critrole.com to check it out. Our fantastic, terrible detectives.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll see. Tonight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll see. Yeah. Starting this week, the Wyrmwood giveaways are back for Critical Role intermission. The giveaways will be hosted on the Critical Role Twitch channel, however, and moving forward, so when we're coming to the break, if you want to jump over to the Critical Role Twitch, it's Twitch.tv/criticalrole. There, you can enter the Wyrmwood giveaways. Keep an eye out for that and we'll remind you before we jump to the break as well. You can watch our hosted stream and our sweepstakes there, at that location. As a reminder, Talks Machina, our after-discussion show about whatever transpires here at this table, is every Tuesday evening. The next episode will be next Tuesday at 7:00 PM Pacific time, hosted by our fantastic Brian W. Foster, if he can get away from Lancaster long enough. He'll be giving out prizes for Gif of the Week, for Fanart of the Week, and all that fun stuff, so check it out on Tuesday. Other than that, let's go ahead and jump in to tonight's episode of Critical Role.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (baby-like wailing) [click, TV static] [groovy Critical Role theme]

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And welcome back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Come in, Harry, come in. Take off your robes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that, you gathered your things, found yourself a better crossbow, and began heading back on the trail along the Crispvale Road and making your way northward. There, you had set up camp for the evening about a day's travel outside of Hupperdook, and during the night, while Yasha and Fjord were taking their watch, wakening Jester with their conversation, and the three of them deciding to step away from the camp as not to wake the rest of you, they were... Well, they went missing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing about the cold atmosphere, you come to the hard, dirt ground patch that you had cleared out for your evening's rest, your packs and tents ready to be reassembled... But it's just the four of you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Jester, I need some pocket bacon for breakfast. Jester? Jester-- oh, she's probably taking a dump in the woods.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think I have some pocket bacon still.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, can I have some?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. It's a little moldy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, that's even better. (eating noises)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Fjord never came back after watch last night.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I stand up and scan the area.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking about, there is a faint mist that is still burning off that clouds your vision far enough to the point where you can't quite see some elements of the mountain range you had just come from, but glancing about around you, there's no sign of your three companions. There's no visuals that guide you to where they might be.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where's Yasha? She's gone too.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She does that sometimes. I'm sure it's nothing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, but--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Fjord?

lines.name: MARISHA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Jester?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The Traveler's bullshit!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's playing--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That really would've worked.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's playing with fire.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to check the tents. I'm going to check the tents to see if their stuff is still there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you go about to their sleeping arrangement spaces, everything except for whatever they had on them as they took their watch is still there. The haversack is left behind, the rest of their goods lying on the ground where they were left.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Their personal belongings and stuff?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Falchion?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The falchion's always with him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right, but his holster thingy. Right? Didn't he have a holster thing, or did I just imagine that because he's Texblade?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He would have a belt with pouches and such, but no, that was on him at the time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: His spats and spurs?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Those are not there, unfortunately.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, wow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Essentially, everything but the equipment they had on them-- in fact, if you look, you can see Jester's shield is there, currently untouched.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's not right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yasha's stuff is still here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha doesn't have much on her. Whatever she does have, she generally keeps on her, so she hasn't left anything behind.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So there's nothing behind?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are their weapons here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't see any weapons. Yasha keeps her weapon on her at all times; Fjord, from what you understand, weirdly never seems to have need. But Jester's weapon is left next to the shield as well as you begin to rummage through.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll take a swig to calm my morning nerves and start searching around to see if there's any notes or any signs of anything around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. That's terrible.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's unbelievably bad.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's an eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right then. As you begin to rummage around in the nearby grasses, tossing over the remains of their left behind materials, even pushing through the fire just in case some of them may have fallen in, no sign.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to check the road for fresh tracks, see if anything looks like it was disturbed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You'd make an investigation check then.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are there trees nearby?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not within the next mile or so.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, for fuck's sake. Same roll. Two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am going to sit down and bring Frumpkin out, and pull out my book and begin to do what's needed to cast it again-- Find Familiar-- but I'm going to turn Frumpkin into, uh... a peregrine falcon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whoa.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was very specific for an "uh" to come before it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) So, as you are both losing yourselves amongst the nearby grasses, and trying to look for any sign of where they may have been, you are focusing on your spell. What are you doing, Beauregard?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I see if I see any grass that's been laid down, like a direction that there might be people who have walked through?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an investigation check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a natural one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're literally scarecrows in the background.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They're probably skinny dipping somewhere!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is amazing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We got a two, a two, a one. What was your first roll?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I rolled a six, which turned into a nine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, so six is our top roll so far.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Knocking it out of the park, y'all.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's all over.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: First roll in the new studio, it's a one!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll get them out now! In the time that you guys have begun to shout, you're continuing to shout their names out, and forge through the nearby grasses. Caleb, you complete your spell, and Frumpkin's form suddenly, slowly shifts, then, with a puff of steam and smoke, turns into the falcon. Lands on your shoulder. (caws)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know, I am sorry. I will change you back as fast as I can. I need you to look for the three that you do not see here. The green one, the blue one, and the goth one. Go!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as Frumpkin takes off into the sky and does a few loops. Go ahead and make a perception check from a bird's eye view, which makes it a little easier.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (cawing)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hey! Thank God.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go! When humanity fails, bring in the hawks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We know nature is better at everything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With a quick, singular pass overhead, you watch as Frumpkin sends you an immediate bit of information. You focus through the eyes, and glancing down, you see a clearing where a large portion of grass, maybe about 60 or so feet from where you guys are, has been pushed down. And you see tracks and drag marks and grooves in the dirt.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh shit. There was a-- This way! I come out of it so I don't trip on rocks. There's a struggle this way. And I lead the group back to this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You guys rush over, and there you can see on the ground this patch of disturbed grass that has been pushed down, along with the dirt that has been jammed and shoved up into small side piles and trenches that were dug in. There's definitely signs of a struggle here. At a quick glance, looking around, footprints and signs, there looks to be somewhere between five to eight sets of footprints you can see from all different angles. And you can see three grooves being dragged through the dirt into the grass, towards the road a little bit northward.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we follow those grooves?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You guys go ahead and follow these the best you can, eventually making your way to the outer side of the Crispvale Road, the path that you were on already, but a little ways north of where you were. And there you can see the grooves end, and a number of sets of heavy wagon wheels begin, or at least have previously pulled off the trail and then pushed themselves back onto the road.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So it's impossible to tell if it's the same one?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we see which direction those wagon tracks went in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard to tell which direction wagon tracks go in, necessarily. Make a survival check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Survival. Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Could be going north. Could be going south. You're not entirely sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That narrows it down! It's not east or west, guys!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Northeast or southwest.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: God damn it!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, that's more narrow. When it was going on the road, was it going towards the direction we were going, or were we following it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're not entirely certain. The tracks seem to be traveling either in the northeast direction that the road goes that you were traveling, or heading back towards Hupperdook. What you do notice, though, and what keys you in that this has something to do with this, is the tracks grind off the road by about five or ten feet, and that's where the grooves of these dragged individuals or sacks stop. And then it pushes back onto the road.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Here is what I am wondering: why we are still here. Yasha and Jester and Fjord, they didn't know each other before a month ago.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who was on watch? It was Fjord and Yasha, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So they would have been awake. But what about Jester? She was asleep, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She also has a big old crushie on Fjord.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If they were taken, that means they came to our camp and took her, possibly. And even if they did not, it's not like we were hiding.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why couldn't we hear anything?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe they weren't targeting anyone specific, just coming to grab folks, and those were the ones that were awake, or closest to the road, or--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You'd take the three beefiest of a group of strangers?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, they took the three ugliest ones. I mean, they left us.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: First, thank you. Second, they may have just taken the ones that were furthest away from the light. They just picked them off, maybe? You walk away from camp, that's what happens. I mean, it's not the biggest or strongest. It's the--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait. I'm going to examine the tracks for blood.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make another investigation check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mmm. That's an 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's better. In looking through near where these cart tracks begin, there's no signs of blood. Going back and following the grooves through the dirt, you find a few small traces.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Anything weird about the blood? Is it green blood, purple blood, blue blood?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, just standard dark, dusted-over blood at this point.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Censored video game blood.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That means that they weren't bleeding when they were dragged, which means that either they were killed by vampires and all their blood was sucked out of them first, or they were still alive.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And that blood was far away from our camp. Maybe they were just triggered by a sound that they heard, and they went to go investigate it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to freak out. Is there any trash or anything on the road? I'm just going to look for any--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's better. 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14? As you look off, looking for any sign of change, there's the fog at the far peripheral of where you're watching. Nothing on the road, except for a couple of tufts of scrub brush, catch your eyes, until you see a dark shape on the road to the south.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Moving?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Moving. It looks to be a shadowed outline of a person.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to draw both swords and head towards it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (powering-up noise) (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Four D batteries. It's very obnoxious.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They run out in half an hour. It's like a Game Gear.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you want my not-cat to go look first?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I may have already moved. I didn't think of that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think Molly's already off.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm following Molly. As I follow Molly, I turn to Nott and Caleb, and I say, just stay back for a second. Back us up if we need it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you've nocked your bolt into your crossbow for the first time. As it winds back, you crank it, and it slips into place. You hear this faint spring tension.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're preparing for this, Molly and Beau start rushing up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. I'm just going to be obvious.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I flank.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you head off into the brush?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Stealth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a stealth check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I send Frumpkin to do a lazy circle.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Man. This feels like last game. 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12, okay. Good to know. Molly, as you get closer, the shape takes more form. As the mist fades and your proximity grows closer, you see a squat figure. Wide and muscular, armored, with a sack over the shoulder. Ashly, if you want to enter?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?! Whoa!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was fast.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is Your Life!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ashly Burch joins us at the table.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, Ashly. Welcome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Ashly, if you'd like to describe what Molly sees as he approaches?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What Molly sees is a dwarven woman with a five o'clock shadow, a cigarette hanging out of her mouth, extremely battered, bloodied, rusted armor, full armor, and short, greasy hair. And she has a big ol' axe in one hand, and a big ol' hammer in the other. Does she see these folk now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a perception check for me.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't have dice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh! We should get that for you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How? This is terrible, here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where'd it go?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, do you want--? Pick a dice bag.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We got plenty.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And here, have a thing.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, hey, thanks guys! It's like I'm part of the crew. Okay. So I'm rolling perception?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. So roll a d20, add your perception modifier.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So much better than us.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you see one figure coming towards you, difficult to make out gender, of lavender skin, curled horns filled with jewelry, big long coat of multi-colors, maroon, but then it goes into a rainbow pattern almost, with two glowing scimitars to each side, staring you down. Behind that, you see two figures a little bit beyond your sight to make out all the details, but one seems to be a tall humanoid, the other seems to be much shorter and smaller, probably halfling, gnome. And then off in the bushes, not hiding very well, you see another figure, keeping low to your left.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Ah, son of a dick. All right, let's get this over with. And then she holds up her battleaxe and her warhammer.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, she's challenging us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As I make eye-contact, I'm like, Aw, shit. Was it the blue? Was I too tall?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm assuming-- Are we going to do this or what?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I would just like a little bit of feedback so I know how to perfect it later.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Are you asking about your hiding?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's shit, man. You gotta choose a new--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck. All right.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I saw you. I thought you weren't trying to hide.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You've got great eyesight.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Not really.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm complimenting you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What the fuck is going on?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's your name?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Through the wire I whisper--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What's your fucking name? You guys got weapons out. What's going on?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's your fucking name?!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What's your fucking name?!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's going on up there?!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We don't know!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should I kill something?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Probably!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I got a place to be, so if we could move this along. Are we fighting or not?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Molly, ask her. We're at an impasse.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Where did you come from? What are you doing in the bloody bushes by our campsite?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I was walking up the road, man. I didn't expect to see a bunch of poorly hidden weirdos with fucking weapons drawn.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (shouts) Just make conversation.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How's your day? (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Weird now!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry. Happens sometimes.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, where are you guys from? Are you from the Run?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's the Run? No, really, what's the Run? That sounds fascinating.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So you're not from the Run.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (shouts) I think she means Shadycreek Run.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, shit. We should have thought about that. I don't know your street lingo.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's just a shortened version of the name.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, you're right again.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're having a very weird day.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just one?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just one. There's still one glowing sword.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The de-escalation has begun.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We more or less got robbed last night and you're the first living human being that we've seen-- or, not human being.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Dwarf.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And by "robbed," he means half of our party got abducted. "Robbed?" That's such a light way of putting it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Whoa! Your party got abducted? When?

lines.name: MARISHA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Last night.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Son of a bitch. Yeah, okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We were actually headed to the Run. It does sound pretty cool.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to walk up next to Molly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (shouts) Yeah, hey, Caleb! Nott!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This tiny figure, hooded, with wrappings, and a creepy porcelain doll face that covers--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right, I pull my hammer back out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should I kill her?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not yet. But keep it drawn.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So all you guys are trying to do right now is to try to get these people back that got got? Is that right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (shouts) They have great sentimental value!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can come up now, Caleb.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (shouts) No, I'm good!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're having a very bad morning. I apologize if we came off a little terse. All right, fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're a little on edge, considering family-- I mean, party members-- were abducted.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right, I got a question. Does anyone have booze?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (smug giggling)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Because I'm more partial to talking... I'm out. My flask is done.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, your flask runs out?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes, weird creepy doll girl!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (smug giggling)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can anyone explain this shit to me? The fuck is happening right now?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (calling) It's complicated!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can you come out of the bush?! Please?!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Frumpkin lands on Nott's shoulder.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A giant falcon (caw) lands.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Ah!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't worry. It's a cat, usually.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have an idea. We've all had a bit of a morning. Let's sit down. Have a drink. We can get you liquor. We can talk about anything you've seen traveling on the road in the last day or two.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What's your name? I like you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm Molly.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Pleasure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is your name Pleasure, then?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, okay. That would've been very inconvenient parenting.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm trying this thing where I'm trying to be more polite, and people say shit like that I guess.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's weird parents that do things.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: My name's Keg.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: As in powder or booze.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Never mind. They're very weird parents.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I like you already. Here, do you have a cup or something I could pour into?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I got a flask.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's sit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I'm going to take out my flask and pour a good, healthy, half quantity. You have to drink it fast. It will disappear soon.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is that true?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What the fuck is with you people? All right, Keg knocks it back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's harsh but functional.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. I know who took your friends.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What? I am the greatest detective of all times! I poured one drink, and I solved the case! (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I know who took your friends. They're not nice people, as you may have gathered. Good thing you were heading to Shadycreek Run because that's where they operate out of.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How do you know? Who are they?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I know. Okay? I know. I'm looking for them too.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you lose someone?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (quietly) Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, I thought you were coming from Shadycreek Run.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No. I ain't been there in a while.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ah. But you've been there.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I've been there. I know it pretty well. It ain't a nice place. It's probably the least nice place that you could all possibly go to, so--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's named Shady.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Shady. Aptly named.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well we're not necessarily nice people, so that'll work out fine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We are well traveled.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. Are you tough? Because you don't look it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (weak growl)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're not.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Was I supposed to be scared?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, I should take off the mask. It's more scary that way. (growl)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Ah! Okay, yeah, that works.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Molly doesn't speak for me. I feel like I can hold my own pretty well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, she's all right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I might actually be the only tough one here. Shit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's not great to hear. Okay. How much do these people mean to you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, they're the only people I've had in my life since my father, so. Parents.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We don't leave people behind, and that's the deal.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right. What are your names?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Plus, we had to go up there anyway.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So it's Molly--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Molly, pleasure.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What's the creepy little one?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (stuttering) Jeff.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nott.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Thank you, Molly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's Nott.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What's your name?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Beau.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Beau. And Bush Man?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ah, I like that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right, Bush Man. Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: My name is Caleb, but you could still call me Bush Man.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do you prefer Bush Man?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, let's think about it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Herr Bush. Why don't you come back to our camp?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Ain't I at your camp?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We are at the camp right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, aren't we in the road? Oh, did we come back?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Walked over as you poured the drink.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, okay. Cool.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to nervously pack while this is going on.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I'm scooping up the haversack.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So here's the deal. Shadycreek Run is full of a bunch of shitty lowlifes. They're all murderers. They're all pieces of shit. The people that took your friends are the biggest pieces of shit in the entire place.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's nice.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who are they?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Murderers. Basic pieces of shit. They're very good at what they do. They are the scariest, most powerful people that I've probably ever met, and I've met a lot of people. I grew up in Shadycreek Run.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When you say powerful, are you talking about ability, or connections, or both?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Both.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Everybody knows them there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You said slavers?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. Sorry to break it you, but your pals just got taken into slavery.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why are they operating this far from "the Run?" Also what kind of slavers-- These are powerful people that they just kidnapped.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. That's what they want.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is why maybe they took the beefy ones.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They're not trying to find weaklings on the side of the road. Which is why it seems like most of you people got spared--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, okay. You don't know us.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hey, you bared your teeth at me five times, little man!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I gave you a little bourbon! I'm a lady. I gave you some booze. The least you could do is afford us the benefit of the doubt.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She does have a fair point, though. We are a little squishy.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm not really good at the people thing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're in good company right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Beau is terrible with relationships and social interactions!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's why we clearly got off to a great start. Sorry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not very good at it either, and you are an exile.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm also trying to work on the manners thing.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Cool, all right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The guy who actually got taken from us was helping me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We lost the charm.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you know any of their names, the Shepherds?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I know all of them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who are they?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. Before that, here's the deal. I have some beef, as you may have gathered, with this crew. I'm not interested in just getting your friends and getting out. I want to fucking kill every single last one of them. If you want any more information from me, I'm going to need a little bit of buy-in.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I just toss 20 gold and I'm like, throw me a cigarette please.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 20 gold is expensive. Wait, so if you could rescue your friends, or friend, or whatever--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There ain't nobody left to rescue, man.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you sure?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, pretty fucking sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So it's revenge, then.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If Shadycreek Run is full of a bunch of criminals, and you said you lived there for a while, what were you doing there?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's not important.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well that's pretty clear.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No one there did anything nice. Okay? So fucking imagine something shitty, and I probably did it, okay? I'm not proud of it! I'm trying to turn a new leaf, as it were.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's like a horror film. The more you leave it up to your imagination, the worse it is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not one to interrogate someone's past. Information's information. We could use some help.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: If you want my aid, I know that place like the back of my hand. I need some kind of assurance that when we find these motherfuckers you're not just going to grab your friends and run. Because I'm going to need some backup if I'm going to take them out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How about equal assurance that you don't fuck us over?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You could also hire us.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hire you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 20 gold.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You just gave me 20 gold.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: 20 gold, all told?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And we split whatever we find.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And you don't fuck us, and we don't fuck you. Unless, like... you know...

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You pay at the end of the deal.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right, deal.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's been a while.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're confident that you can lead us to these Shepherds.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I've been tracking them for a while.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, we are, some of us, a self-deprecating lot. We have some skill between the four of us, but it would help a lot to know what kind of people-- not just assholes; we are assholes-- what kind of assholes we are talking about.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sorcerers. Barbarians. There's a little shit that's a rogue.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How many of them are there?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There's five.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, we're five!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, kind of. We're probably a good three and a half, if we're being honest.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't put yourself down like that. I'm sure you can hold your own.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There's five.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are they part of a larger organization, or are they off themselves? It's just them?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They work for someone, a family in Shady Creek Run. They're powerful.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're mobsters! Weird question: have I heard about this group, considering my background?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a history check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to get rid of this one. Where's Laura with her dice jail when you need it? That's an 18 that I just rolled now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have not heard of the Iron Shepherds before. You have some base knowledge of some families that might do business in the outside, but the information you've been given so far, the Iron Shepherds don't ring a bell.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know, when we were in Zadash, we heard the town crier talking about kidnappings in Nogvurot. That's close to Shadycreek Run. Could that be the same people, do you think?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I mean, possibly. There's a lot of folks doing the same kind of work. These folk happen to be the best at it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you know all of the members of this Iron Brigade-- what's it called?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Close enough.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Iron Shepherds.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Iron Chef.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Iron Shep.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's my favorite travelling cuisine entertainment.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I prefer Iron Fem Shepard.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This is my favorite D&D game on the Citadel.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There it was. I was waiting for it. If someone else wasn't going to get there, I was going to do it. So thank you for taking it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: One of them wouldn't happen to be named Ophelia Mardun, were they? No? Okay. That's the woman we have to find for The Gentleman. That's part of the reason we're going.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I try not to learn their names. I don't want to get attached.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is an aspect of that name that does ring a bell: the last name.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh shit, say that again?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mardun.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Here, let me pour you some more booze.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does that help?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes, I suddenly remember that name. I know the family. They've got connections there. In fact, the folks that the Iron Shepherds work for happen to hate that family.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is all connected!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Rival mob gangs!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's like a conspiracy, and we're in the middle of it!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You being a detective, you hear other people say information and then you remark upon it, and then that's you saying you're a great detective?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In large part. The subject was confused as to what a detective is. I'm not writing. I don't have a quill. It's something that me and one of our lost friends talked about a lot. Sorry.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sorry. Again, I'm not great with people.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do we have an arrangement here? A deal?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll kill these folks, or try to anyway.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't like that last part.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What if one gets away? We're going to hunt them down over our lifetime? I don't know, what if they go far away? Are we indebted to you forever now, or can we put a 30 day cap on this?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: These three are of great value to us and they are our friends, and we are better off with them, and it is worth the trouble. We cannot accomplish what we've come out here to do in the first place without them. What?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nothing. You sure sound like our new leader.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, what about me?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Don't panic about it, it's going to be fine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yeah, no.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Aw, cool. Real cool, Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, he's got the intelligence.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You be the leader. But do we have a deal?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, we have a deal.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm all in for this.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right. Well, let's get going, then.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you just walking? Do you have any means of transportation?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do I look like I have-- no!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have spare horses now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At which point, you look over past the camp where they are, and there's a cart and there are a number of horses that are currently hitched to it at the moment. For a brief moment, you're like, Oh, the thought of not having to travel on foot sounds fantastic.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Let's do that. Let's please, god, do that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're half packed already.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys pack up your goods, get the rest of your material packed up, couple things to keep in mind. Looking at the map, if you want to pull it out and get an idea of the direction you're traveling.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, we have a map of some sort? Should we lay it out on the table and see if--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As long you guys can see it is more the job here. You can travel with your horses--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Weights?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sam take one side.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With your horse and cart--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sponsored by Wyrmwood.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Look at that! Timing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's how it's done.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There you go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you were to leave the cart behind as an option, you could go faster.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But we'd have to ditch some gear, or do we have enough horses to carry everything including shields?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We would have to ditch some.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I think we ditch the cart. They've got hours on us, we need to make time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I agree.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How much can we carry?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we carry all of our friends' stuff on a horse? We have six horses, I think.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have six horses between five of you, as long as one of you takes the horse head you can have a pack horse, essentially. It's going to be hard to direct it, unless someone keeps it hitched on the side. Having an additional horse right now, how are you going to get that to come with you at a fast pace... without a rider?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And we can't carry their stuff without.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can probably carry a few things. You still have horses to help carry things, most of your gear you can still put on yourself. Are there any large things? You're not carrying a manticore head anymore.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We leave the shield. It's not a magical shield, it's not special.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's not?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Jester's?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's run of the mill.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, hang on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's not special to her in any way?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I open the haversack.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Life is more special.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And start trying to shove as much as I can in the haversack.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ow, what are you doing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm trying to-- Just wait, don't move.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The main pack, I'd say you can-- I'm going to say the shield's not going to fully fit in it unfortunately. It's a fairly wide shield and won't quite fit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What about a tent? Can I shove a tent in here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A tent you can probably mangle and push in there and you manage to get the tent in. But the shield someone will have to wear on their back or strap to a horse.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, let's strap it to a horse.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are we going to try and pack horse this? Is that how we're--?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No I think we can...

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Go faster without a spare horse.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think the shield and--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The big things we're leaving?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We put a tent in there and if we want to attach another tent to the back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: DM, you said we could put the shield on the side of a horse?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can put the shield-- strap it to a horse, it's fine because it's just an additional thing you're strapping on to it. It's up to you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's just the additional horse is going to be a problem if you're going to travel at a fast pace.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well then, we shouldn't do that, we should go as fast as we can right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we're leaving behind a horse and a cart.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or we take the horse and cart at reasonable speed.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, we should leave them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there a town coming up? Or some place where we can quickly sell the horse and cart?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or stow it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, there is the Crispvale Thicket ahead which has the crossroads, but there's no town there-- Hupperdook behind you, or, honestly, Nogvurot or Shadycreek Run.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We lead the horse to water, we force it to drink, we give it some food, hope it lives.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We set it free.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe come back and find it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Or it's free or somebody gets a new horse.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We hang a sign on it. "Free horse."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why don't we kill it and take some meat? All right, let's just leave it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I mean, not to put a damper on it, but if you leave a horse around here, it's probably going to get killed. There's a lot of shady folks around here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, the horses are all named after--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Poop.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Poop. So we can probably--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So which one do you leave behind then?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So we're going to drop a Loaf.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's always better to drop a Loaf before you go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's leave a marker.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm starting to rethink my agreement to work with you guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome to the Mighty Nein.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If he's going to die, we have to leave a marker so we can come back and find where he's been interred.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Poop joke.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Skidmark.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you say goodbyes to Loaf...

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We squeezed about as much as we can out of that one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You strap your materials to the horses you are taking with you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's been a while.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're going at a fast pace. That's 30 miles.

lines.name: SAM, MARISHA
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You travel in day. Which will get you well within the Crispvale Thicket. As you guys are riding, who's guiding this trip? Who's keeping an eye on the road ahead of you as you go?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is one of us steering the journey, and can another one of us be looking for clues or things along the way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can do that. Sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was going to say--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keg should lead.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Keg's been on this road before.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, can someone do me a favor? Does anyone have a piece of cloth or something they're not using?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have a giant dragon tapestry.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Could I borrow that maybe?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you cold?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is the one thing you see strapped, laying over the back of his horse. This giant, rolled up, thick, blue and silver tapestry.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, I wrap my head around it-- with it, I should say. So you can't really see my face.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You now have a cape, it's huge.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you take the full tapestry or just a piece of it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think the full tapestry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so yeah-- it's you are just--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Swimming in it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why are you hiding your face?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I didn't leave with a lot of friends last time I was here. So I'm trying to keep a low profile.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're well disguised as a stoner's bedroom at the moment. A dragon on a sheet.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Perfect, I'll fit right in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I guess I can lead, since I know where I'm going.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You've traveled this path before, so it's well known. Who's keeping watch?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll keep watch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and make a perception check for me, Beau.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hopefully there are no more ones hiding in there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you want to look at the thing, the orb?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, you're good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, the orb, we haven't--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have to look at the orb at some point too or hexagon. Dexa--

lines.name: MATT, TALIESIN
lines.text: Dodecahedron.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, as you're heading down into the center part of the northern side of the Marrow Valley. Keeping a look ahead, you can see just as you crest over this one little embankment, the Crispvale Thicket ahead of you. This beautiful cluster of dark-green trees. The clouds have completely taken the sky back and it's this low, gloomy gray as the air gets chilly, as the day progresses onward getting closer and closer to dusk. You manage to get to the outskirts of the thicket itself. You see the trees growing thicker and the actual canopy of dark green pine trees starting to gather. You now have the opportunity, if you want to, you can travel into the crossroads and head north, or you can skirt around the forest off the path. Those are your-- because you haven't-- you're basically having to go to the center and then back north, but you're on the road the whole time. Or if you wanted to skip past it, you'll travel a little slower-- basically a similar pace.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But we won't encounter as many foes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well you don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It just depends on your--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we trying to avoid people or--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm more than happy to kill something at this point. I've got some anger and aggression to work out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's the faster route?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a survival check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, you've left the cart behind which means the one factor that would've really come into that, is no longer an issue.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're on horses, let's just cut through.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do we get a sense of where they're headed? Do we see any sign of--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, in the main road, there are a number of tracks. Whether it be horse, foot, and cart and wheels of all different sizes. You're not able to really tell what's the freshest from a glance. If you want to get off your horse and inspect you can try.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll try. Would that be--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would be survival.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How good is my survival? Eh, it's okay. A natty one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Welcome to the team.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't even know what horses are anymore.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is a donkey.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance down-- From atop your horse you look down and see these smattering of patterns, and as you get down closer it just becomes dirt, and you have no idea how to discern what came when.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm drunk. That was pointless, let's keep going.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (vomit sound)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, which path do you guys wish to choose?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb, you're in charge. Which way are we going?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, for gods' sakes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well he's so--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Which way are we going?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I say we go through the woods, but you're the leader.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I said you were the leader.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not a leader.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, for gods' sakes, I'm going to start going through the woods.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're going through the thicket or around the outside of it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, around. The shortcut.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you're skirting the outside of the thicket.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you start cresting around the side of the forest, within the first mile or so, you see an abandoned homestead. Maybe 200 feet or so away from the forest on the northern side. It may have been at one time a small farmhouse, but part of the roof is caved in. There once was a window that had pane glass that has since been shattered, and you can see jagged edges along the bottom side of its sill.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What time is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right now? I'd say it's probably close to four or five in the afternoon. You have a couple hours before dusk really starts hitting.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do we want to head a couple hours or have this unbelievably safe place. What looks like a very safe place, although-- never mind. We're going to-- terrible things are just going to happen. I'm accepting it, this is going to be a cursed trip. Do we want to stay in the haunted house?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you want to send in Frumpkin, bird Frumpkin, see what he finds?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does it look like Frumpkin could make it through that window?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Frumpkin could, yeah. And it's a one story farmhouse. It's a modest home. Single story, maybe from first glance, three to four rooms, and the partially collapsed roof on one side shows you that's it's been in disuse for some time. Who knows how weathered it may be on the interior.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And what hour is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About four or five in the afternoon.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In the afternoon. I don't see anything in there. I mean, you want to raid an old house or keep going?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sleep in it, is what we're thinking.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You want to cut for the day?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We want to keep going, don't we? As fast as we can.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well here's the question: do we just go until we have to stop and then we camp wherever we're going to camp, or do we find something like this, which is possibly a little safer and then just wake up very early and run and go further?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: If you ask me, keep going. No place in this area is going to be safer than any other.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, let's keep going.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's the local.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Trust the local.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you guys continue.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As we go by it-- we're headed that way, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Was there anyone in that house?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You didn't get close enough to inspect.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Should we check it out and see if there's anything good?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Throw a falcon through the window.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well that's what I was asking. You described a window that was jagged glass, ja?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But if my smallish falcon went in there, is he going to get cut up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can certainly try.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Chimney.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Going to get cut.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, Frumpkin's wingspan in this form is pretty wide, wider than the window. So Frumpkin would have to land on the window and then probably gingerly step in.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or you could go through the chimney or the collapsed roof.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Or I can just go in.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Keg just goes to the door and kicks it open.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys watch as the horse rides off to the edge. Keg leaps off the horse.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I like her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a layer of dust everywhere. There is a smell of old rot and mildew. And glancing inside, you can see there's another window on the opposite side that's also been busted out. This place is pretty thrashed.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There's nothing in here!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are there any books?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to hop in there as well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll go take a look.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Books!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll look for you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We always know to look.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm not going to look for boo-- Oh god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you looking for--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Keg sits down on one of the pieces of furniture.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I also want to see if there's-- does it look like people have been in here recently?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well you make an investigation check on that. And you make an investigation check to look for things. And if you want--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I look for booze?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, go for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nothing of value.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh. Sadly no booze.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Damn it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What did you roll?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hard to tell in this space.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's not fair.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A lot of the furniture looks damaged, some of it looks burned weirdly. As you, looking around on the inside, you're rummaging around for any possible books or anything that can be useful. You don't find any books, you do manage to find a bundle of unused torches, five. You have a handaxe that's a little old and rusted, but it's still functional. It's well made. That was left under one of the shelves that had fallen over. And you find a mostly filled oil lantern. While the glass of the actual lantern is broken, it still is pretty filled with oil. So if you wanted to-- if you had a container, you could fill it and have a flask of oil.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have an extra flask.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then you can go ahead and fill it with oil.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will fill that with oil.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now you have a flask of oil at your disposal.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there a crest on the fireplace or anything like that? Any markings of who might have lived here at one point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's almost like elements of-- as you pick it up and glance at it, the pockmark scarring on it is strange. And the mantle around it, you can see, a lot of the wood and stonework seems to have been smoothed over in its damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I remove the piece?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. It snaps off.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (quietly) I have a symbol of Pelor.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll just go around and ask: does anyone need any torches? I found a bunch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll take a couple torches.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take a torch.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can each have one.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sure, I'll take a torch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get a torch, and you get a torch.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And how about a handaxe, anyone?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nein.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nah, I'm good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Caleb, you want to do a little scan while we're here? See if anything tingles your fancy?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (sighs) We're killing time but yes I do. I take the ten minutes to take the book out of the holster, and set it on the ground and while everyone just sits there in the dust, I cast Detect Magic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So how long does it take for that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ten minutes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten minutes, okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait. Wait.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wait.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As a ritual I believe it's ten minutes, correct?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so Caleb-- you're having this moment where you're waiting as he's just poring over this tome and drawing a circle on the ground and inscribing strange symbols in the air. It doesn't make any sense. You're like, "Ah, magic stuff."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (pouring noise)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Bless you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everybody else roll a perception check, if you don't mind.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17, what did you get?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (counting) 19 actually.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beau and Keg, you guys hear some noises out back. The horses are getting a little restless and nervous. They're like (anxious chuffing) and you see two of them are starting to clomp back a bit away from the house. Starting to pull at the reins that have been hitched off to the side of the home.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hey, you might want to finish your fairy shit. There's something going on outside.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At that point, trying to take in what is sending these horses into a weird tizzy, and you feel this faint vibration in the ground, this very subtle quaking.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm still outside on my horse. So I'm going to ride around to the back of the house, and see if I see anything.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to run outside, and see if I see anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, still utilizing the same perception checks you have, looking in both directions, nothing. There is-- you're maybe a little over a hundred feet or so from the tree line. Which is what you were staying close to, to not be out in the middle of the open field. But you don't see anything coming or going.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll pull a single sword and guard Caleb.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to jump off my horse and get on the ground and feel the ground. Do I feel any vibrations?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do. There's this faint (soft rumbling), and it seems to be moving in shifts or in pulses of intensity, getting more intense and some of them longer and some of them shorter.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I-- were you going to keep going?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, that's what you're sensing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I say: Get off the ground!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I run, and I'm going to try and parkour up onto the roof of this thing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to try and push Caleb awake and go for a tree.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh yeah, I hear everything.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, what--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's go! let's go! And we're going to head for a tree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you guys are headed for the trees?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Dispel the spell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Spell's lost, Molly and Caleb start running out of the home to the tree line. And you're just going up on the roof?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there a roof to be got upon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're still on horseback, you can jump off your horse.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, I jumped off my horse to feel the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, right. So you're leaving your horse there and if-- you can try and look up on the roof. Part of it's collapsed. You don't know the state it's in, but you can try.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll get on my horse and head for the tree line with everyone else.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay (galloping). You start heading back to the tree line. What are you guys doing?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So we can't tell if this is a creature or a-- we just can feel the ground rumbling.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone has just started getting nervous and rushing for the tree line. You can hear the faint rumbling, and it is getting louder.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to take-- as I get closer to the tree line-- how far away am I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're about 20 or so feet from the tree line.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to take my horse and I'm going to whip it around the opposite way, going away from us, and I'm going to give it a good kick and jump off of it. And head towards the tree line with everybody else. I'm going to head it away from us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Your horse begins to head in a southward direction.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm staying where I am, and I'm taking out my battleaxe and my warhammer. I'm going, "Come "out, you piece of shit!"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're staying by the house?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm staying in the house, and I'm going to cover myself up with some detritus of different chairs and things, near the window. I'm hiding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a stealth check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What are we running from?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb and Molly, you guys are riding towards the treeline.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're getting some distance from whatever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First thing you notice is a splash of dirt to the south. You see a small detonation out of the earth in the direction of where your horse had been traveling off. You see something emerge from the ground and your horse ride up and hoof down and begin to run back in your direction away from it. It seemed to cut it off at the south. As it is running towards you--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Come on, WC, come on!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see something spray or splash in its direction as it turns, and it whinnies in horrible pain before it collapses onto the ground, spinning.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Water Closet!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Aw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It lies there on the ground, making this horrible (squealing) sound. As you're watching, from what you can see in the distance, its flesh burning.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is it dying?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks in a really bad place. At this point in time, Molly and Caleb, you hear the vibration as the ground bursts to the right and left of you. Let me get the map, since that's where we're going now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! Should we move this map?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, we're going to move this map out of the way.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh boy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh man.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Ah!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh gosh!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Ah jeez!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ashly, welcome to the show.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hey, thanks for having me, guys.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's been a while.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I know. It's been a minute. Since your one-shot, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, but that doesn't count. Weren't you on the show-show at some point?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Mm-mm. This is my first time on the show-show.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, she did that goblins thing with us.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I've done three one-shots, but no show-show.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (gasps) That's terrible.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughs) I'm here now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, we're rectifying it right now.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Goblins, The Screw Job, and then the Ass Sailor? What was it called?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The romantic cruise thing.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The Ass Sailor?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, The Ass Sailor was the name of the-- Oh! You were in the bar! The bar was, yes, The Ass Sailor.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I keep looking over at you and thinking I'm on the Jerry Lewis telethon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I thought we were all going to dress up tonight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your horses are currently--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, so they went after them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: While you guys are over by the house, you watch as this is going on, and there doesn't appear to be any action immediately near you, so you're quite a distance away.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I rush forward now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can. If your horse is still right by the-- No, your horses rushed off towards the--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Her horse is still there.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think my horse is still there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your horse is still there, that's right. You still have your horse there. You can jump on your horse and head that direction, if you want to.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you rush onto that. I need everybody to roll initiative, please, because we are now in combat.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: God! I think I spent all of my 20 juice on all these one-shots.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You got that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I know, but it's still a one!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beau's up first. 20 to 15?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Molly's up next. 15 to ten?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's the anti-snitch.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nega-snitch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb, what did you get?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Drei.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. And? Ooh.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. It makes sense. I'm riding in late.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're also three?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm three, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not so great for Keg. That's all right. Top of the round, Beau.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, man. Oh my god.

lines.name: MATT
