lines.text: I will say that I don't want to get hung up trying to help those people while we're in Shady Run.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, you know. If we can. We're not altruistic by nature, either.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, if we stumble upon one of them maybe be like, "Hey. Met your grandma."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Some days it's not hard to do a good turn.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But let's be clear, we're going to eliminate the problem.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Cheers.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Save our friends. And if we can do something extra, we do something extra. When we can.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And maybe even complete our mission.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'd forgotten about that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know that's a big deal, that whole mission completing thing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Been a little distracted.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, let's run these bastards down, ja?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Are you going at a normal pace, or a fast pace?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fast pace.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: At a fast pace Matthew-- I'm on horseback with Caleb right? Could I be on the back, maybe just flipping through Jester's sketchbook?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to look through the whole thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. It is absurd. There are sketches across the spectrum of silly-faced interpretations and caricatures of the people you've met, of each of you. There are little notes to The Traveler throughout. You see people that you've liked in the past looking beautiful, with tiny bodies, you see people who you've hated in the past getting stepped on by a poop monster. It's childish in all the delightful ways that you'd expect from Jester's capability.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it all drawings? Are there any notes, or letters, or clues to her past?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are notes. (pause) I will say, Laura is not here to specify necessarily, that there are passages in Common to The Traveler. What languages do you know?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Common, Goblin, Halfling.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Longer ones.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If only there were a tiefling here, who possibly spoke and read the same language.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Or a wizard who can read anything.

lines.name: LIAM, TALIESIN
lines.text: Keep it to yourself.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Keep it to myself. [yelling] Keep steering Caleb, I'm looking at nudie pictures!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you carry on at a pretty good pace, and you're traveling rather swiftly. Though traveling at this speed, it's harder to perceive things at a distance. Thankfully, this renewed vigor from the tea that you had for the evening may help you in that endeavor as well. So, who is keeping watch on the roads ahead of you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Go ahead and make a perception check with advantage, and minus five to whatever you--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So advantage minus five on both?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay that's not good; that's a one. Okay, that means I got a seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay then.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Seven?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: At advantage minus five on both the rolls I rolled a nine, and a one. So hey.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the next eight hours or so, you guys continue on the trek on the outskirts of the Crispvale Thicket. Eventually coming to meet up with the Glory Run Road that heads northward to the direction of Nogvurot. You can see there's a road sign that specifically points up to Nogvurot, southward to the crossroads. Following the map and the path you've charted out, in your experience as well, you travel for quite a ways along Glory Run and then just head straight north towards the Quannah Breach, so you'll be going off into just grassland and scrubland at a certain point.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Off-roading.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Essentially. About then eight hours hit, you have another hour or so before the sun begins to go down. You can continue to push for another hour if you'd like to, and all take constitution saving throws, it's up to you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If we do the one more hour it's constitution checks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can do the one more hour, or you can stop and set an early camp and get another evening's rest. But, you do not spot anything along the way. It's a beautiful open field.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm sharp. I should always do this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we getting close to where you think their headquarters are?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How far do we have to Shadycreek?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You probably have maybe two days' more travel before you get there.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm down to push the other hour, but my constitution is (clicks tongue).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm down as well, but--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's do it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Same.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And in that hour we can look for a place to rest? It's like pushing for the next rest stop.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, one more. We push it one more hour.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do we want to go at a steady pace for this last hour, or do we want to push for a fast pace?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fast equals a constitution check, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you travel for another hour of additional movement, which will get you probably another six miles ahead, then we'll see if you get a point of exhaustion.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You push for the ninth hour. I need you all to make constitution saving throws, please.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we look for a good camping spot?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh shit!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Natural 20? I don't want to hear it!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Natural 19. 21.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 13 total.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb, you take a point of exhaustion. The rest of you do not.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sweet, this is my first. What happens to me? Do I die on the spot?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Disadvantage on your checks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On ability checks, that's all.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And you're hangry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's my secret, Taliesin. I'm always hangry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the sky grows dark, the still gray clouds that have taken the sky overhead, the temperature is dropping significantly. It looks like it's going to be a particularly cold night. Do you wish to continue pushing on?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Along the way, do we see anything that looks like a good alcove or somewhere that would be nice?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Which we have advantage on, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Eight hours, and you said the eight hours was--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've push now past hour nine, so you cannot have advantage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A six and-- oh, no advantage? I'll take that six with my add perception of three, so nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nein.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Best you can find looking around, there are a few small boulders or pieces of natural rock formations that have pushed up out of the local hills, as you are moving through this more hilly area of the northern valley, but there's no alcoves or caves that you're catching a vision of that would give you safe and out of the public eye.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does it look like if we push a little bit further, there's any change in terrain?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's only one way to find out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Even in far distance?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can travel for another hour.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, there's a way to do that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Want to do one more hour and call it?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Or Owl Boy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's hangry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We could push it, too. I'm good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's send the owl.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Five minute little fly-ahead?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I hold on to my horse and stop hearing everybody. Disadvantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's the owl, technically, not him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's terrible. It's perception, was that what I was doing? Five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this distance, it looks like it's straight, moving, rolling hills and bursts of stone.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's getting dark out here, and I'm tired.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we can find a stone for cover, maybe.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll take watch.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll set up a proper camp.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll take watch with Keg.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Great.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Before I go to sleep, I do the silver thread.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First watch is you two. Do you wish to combine your perception checks for this watch, or take them individually?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll individually.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First watch manages to go by. You both keep a very sharp eye out in the distance. Nothing seems to catch your attention, though the night is getting quite cold. Towards the end of your watch, snowfall begins to slowly descend upon the northern valley.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Chilly. Sure glad I have all this booze to drink to keep me warm. Wouldn't you like some?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have 200 pounds of pure muscle. I never get cold.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, it tastes good, though. So there's that, too.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Why you trying to cozy up to me?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm not trying to cozy up to you! I think we got off on the wrong small feet.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You mean when you bared your teeth at me four times?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have to bare my teeth at everyone! Look at these things, they're huge!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You have no choice?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: When I smile, it looks like I'm trying to bite your throat off.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Show me?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (snarls)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Ooh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I like tongue. I was eating some tongue when you saw me.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, I forgot about that. I thought you were coming on to me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No! Oh god, no.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, you don't have to be that disgusted.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're a handsome woman, but-- you're a woman, right?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, good. Just making sure.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Just because I have a five o'clock shadow, doesn't mean I'm not a woman.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know! I don't want to presume anything.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right, I'll have some booze.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, here you go. You know, it never runs out.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It doesn't?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Huh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Special trick. So, uh, who got took? Who are you missing?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, that's where this conversation stops, friend.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No! What? I thought we were getting to know each other.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's a big gun to pull out right after you gave me a little bit of libation.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, did you go to school?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Fucking guess, detective. Do you think I went to school?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hmm, I would say no.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. Accurate.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you have a happy home life growing up?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I grew up in Shadycreek Run. Everyone's favorite pastime there is stabbing people. No. I didn't have a nice... growing up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hmm. I'm trying to think of a topic that's less charged. Do you have a favorite sports team you like? (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We could talk about Iron Chef.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Iron Chef? I love Iron Chef. Never mind.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I just thought, well--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I know. You're trying to be nice.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If we knew the circumstances around their untimely demise.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I know the Shepherds well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Were you one of them?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No. I wasn't. I just know them well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you go to high school-- no, you didn't go to school-- Hmm, everyone else is snoring.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They're well known. Everyone there knows them. There's no way to not know them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So you're not trying to chat me up so much as you're trying to siphon information.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm doing what any good detective does, which is just lay the groundwork for the case--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Under who?! Who considers you the greatest detective?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Jester. Jester's one of the folks that got stolen. Together we were a dynamic duo of mystery solving. We could solve any mystery. Find any criminal mastermind, no matter how nefarious. We had all the tools, all the insights, all the instincts! It was amazing. We were a well oiled machine and then... she was taken. And now it's just me.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm guessing she had most of the brains of this duo.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I resent that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to try to help get her back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You don't have to say it like that, I'm just not much of a sharer!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Something you haven't told anyone. It'll be like a game! And we'll each take a shot.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Shot first.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Here you go. (pouring noise)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Uh... My friend was a slave. Was enslaved by them... By the Shepherds. So?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm a pretty good dancer!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I thought we were doing like some deep dive shit!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I didn't know!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You were asking me some deep dive questions! You're going to fucking give me the dancer shit?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I didn't know! I thought we were going to start small and then build!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No, because you set the precedent of asking a serious question and then you gave me the shot--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You gave me the heaviest shit first though!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's what you wanted, I thought!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Of course!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (yelling) We're trying to sleep for gods' sakes!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (hoot owl call)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, this has been fun.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I'm up too. Molly, you want to take next watch?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's take the next one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I'm going to fucking bed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, both roll.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you guys go to bed, the both of you keep an eye out for the rest of the evening. For the rest of your watch, at least; and seemingly uneventful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Want to gamble?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm not much of a gambler, you're thinking of Jester.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I'm not.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is a game we used to play.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Take my cards, set the deck down. Put a question on the deck, whoever draws the highest card has to answer it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait are these like playing cards or tarot cards?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Tarot cards but they have numbers.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know I fucking hate those things.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't want anything to do with them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll throw one out there for you. What's the best lie you've ever told?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The best lie I've ever told?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Whoever gets the highest has to tell.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or whoever gets the lowest has to tell.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, deal.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's roll d20's, see whose number is lower.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just in case here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can be a little vague with it. You don't have to be... I rolled very high.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Natural twenty.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Seventeen, shit.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Ooh.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You played yourself.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I did.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This one has a pretty big number on it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Shite. Best lie I've ever told... I pretended to be royalty for three weeks. For a scam.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's fascinating, what kind of scam?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was-- Just a little while after I had gotten my consciousness sort of sorted out, and we got into a town and figured out that we could actually get some nice digs and they were seeing if I could maybe bullshit my way through it, and it was kind of my test. So I pretended to be a reincarnated royalty from across the sea.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. (laughing)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's pretty fascinating.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was a lot of fun.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you not like knowing your past, that way you can have multiple backstories? Be multiple people at once?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I like knowing that because it's not there that it doesn't matter? And it helps knowing I don't think it matters for anybody. I don't care where anybody's from, it's nice. I certainly don't care where I'm from.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll tell you one of my best lies, the one I was most proud of.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I pour-- I pass the drink.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just because it was a pretty good one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's usually how this rolls.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. There was a politician in the town where I grew up that I didn't like very much.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Politician?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe I shouldn't be proud of that actually.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, no I'm very impressed, actually, that's-- you are a good friend to have and a terrible enemy to make.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah... anyway.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Cheers.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Cheers.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Night.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just maybe don't have a job that relies on relationships, either.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's very fair.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Public opinion--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They really had it coming.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rest of your watch goes uneventful, leaving to Caleb the final watch.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll take this myself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Make a perception check. Actually you and Frumpkin can both make separate ones, I'll let you do that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good. Frumpkin got-- I'm going to use my cat stats, because I don't have owl stats handy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I can pull those up pretty quick.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh okay, good.

lines.name: SAM, TALIESIN
lines.text: Cat stats. (musical riff) Cat stats!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so that would be a plus one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Eleven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That rely on hearing or sight, so you have advantage on it though, because the owl does have keen hearing and sight.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thirteen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thirteen, okay. Looks like this watch is uneventful as well. You guys had a clean night.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, so, sitting in the silence, are any of these people awake, that I can tell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They all seem pretty asleep.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One's weird. One of them tried to kill you. The other one, she's adorable, but-- Stupid. This one here. What do you expect to do with her? How is she going to help you do what you want to do? She can watch your back--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (hooting)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You should just go. You have told too much. I am going to go. It's time to go. He sits there for a solid five minutes. Then two hours. Wait for everyone to wake up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a mild break in the clouds on the eastern horizon over the Ashkeeper and the Dunrock Mountains. You're still getting a mostly cloudy sky, but there are occasional bits of morning light, faint light blues and yellows, and soft white. The snowfall that has come throughout the evening and packed up the very chilly cold night is beginning to faintly thaw, but it is still a very cold morning. As you all begin to come to consciousness and gather your things, the clouds close once more, and you look off towards the northeast side of the valley and you can see another darkened cloud coming with more snow and a less forgiving turn of weather. Although it's a ways off, you can see it this far away. You pick up your things, horses at the ready. Do you continue your journey? Anything you want to do before you head off?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do my morning push-up and pull-up routine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Squats.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And then I'm ready to go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You have to set two horses side by side and use your staff there to give you pull ups. There's not any trees here, but you manage to pull it together.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dope as fuck, yes I do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She can do it on the road.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Holy shit you guys I just figured out how we can save 30 minutes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On the road while you're-- You're just Chuck Norris-ing it between the two horses. (galloping noises)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It goes without saying that Keg is aroused.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You should do that Arnold monologue from that documentary, (Schwarzenegger voice) "You know "when I am with my-- I am coming. And then when I'm working out I am coming always."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (Schwarzenegger voice) I feel like I'm always coming.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Always.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a deep callback, wow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pushing on at what pace? I imagine continuing at your hurried pace?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ja.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pushing on for the remainder of this day, who is keeping watch?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take a round.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll perception for me, please.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Minus five?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, minus five because you're traveling at fast pace.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Natural 20. 23, minus five is--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're not quite there yet, but you're getting close to where the direction you should continue on breaks off of Glory Run, but you're still on the road. You do see a small caravan making their way southward in your direction.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Once they get a little closer, let's slow down and walk to the side of the road and take a look at this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys move off to the side.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I tell from looking at the cart if there's anything off about it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's got five wheels.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing off, as you approach, you begin to make out details. You do not recognize this troupe, and the cart seems like there are tarps and cloths laid over large bundles. They are obscured from view specifically so the contents cannot be seen, which is not what you're looking for.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They don't want anyone to see what's under the tarp, which is not the usual operation that you've seen. The folks that travel southward, they're dressed like normal traveling merchants: not of a wealthy regard, but those who probably bring common supplies, things from the northern side, bringing them southward. It looks like they have supplied up for a trade run and they're heading southward. As they ride past you guys to the right side, they give a nod.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb, should I go check them out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The next rider gives a nod.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They're not who we're looking for.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, okay.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You can if you want to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are they suspicious?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Not from what I can see.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What kind of traders do they look like? What are they trading in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're not the kind of people that can defend it, so it's maintain mystery and keep pushing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. We can go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You continue on. On this next leg of your journey, we're riding on your perception roll off the road, your natural 20. I'll let that stand for a bit. The pace that you've been keeping on this without being kept by your cart has gained you quite a bit of ground and about another two hours or so into this afternoon, your eyes catch another cluster of carts facing the same direction you are.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I make a perception check on this one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You may.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It takes you a moment of getting close and you're about, I'd say, a quarter mile back from this troupe. You can see the familiar two larger carts, one smaller. It stinks of familiarity to you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This might be them.

lines.name: MARISHA, SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did we catch up to them?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We may have.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb, look at this picture of you in Jester's book. It's really funny.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's not the time, Nott!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, no?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We shouldn't clue them off that we're here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, let's slow our pace.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Maybe a couple of us could flank around? What's the terrain?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're moving, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're moving, yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can your owl see if there's a big human man, fighter-looking guy?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bigger than average-sized man, you mean?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. He's pretty surly, intimidating looking. He might have a half-elf with him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, we're about to get into it, yeah?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we should wait until they start to set up camp. They've got to stop at some point.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We don't even know who they are yet, though.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What time is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's mid-afternoon at this time. You've been traveling since shortly after daybreak, so it's three o'clock in the afternoon. You have another hour or so before you hit your eight hour mark and your horses start tiring and you start tiring.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're nowhere near Shadycreek?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're a couple days' travel or so from it at this pace.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're going to have to camp.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll tell you what I do is, I dab my thumb into my belt for a bit of sweet oil and I rub it on my bottom lip and mutter an arcane word or two and say: I suggest you tell us any details you've been holding back about these people so that we are fully prepared. That is a Suggestion spell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, it is. I'm going to have to ask you, Keg, to make a wisdom saving throw, please.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is not a success. You feel, strangely, though it is out of character for your intent, magically compelled to offer up a fair amount of information that would seem useful in the coming scenario about these individuals.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We love our guests. We love them.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How much more do I have to tell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As much as would seem useful for this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was details that would help us in the situation.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have to say everything?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're compelled to say anything that's useful in what we're about to do with these people.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. Interpret that as you feel necessary.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Any other details that you've been holding back that would help us in this situation.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Lorenzo is a fighter type?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do know that he walks with this nasty-looking glaive. It's a polearm with a large hooked blade at the end of it that he uses as both a symbol of station and a very dangerous weapon, if need be. Gives him reach, gives him range.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I tell you about that, and Juam. She's a human barbarian. She's not as bad as the rest of them. That's all I know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No magic?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There's a sorcerer.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And a druid.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're pretty sure there's a sorcerer, you're pretty sure there's a druid. You don't know a lot about magic stuff, but you know one of them seems to be more nature-based and the other seems to throw spells, but is cock-sure and charismatic.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you know anything about the cages they keep their prisoners in? Are they magically enchanted or are they just cages?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They'll look like normal trade from the outside. They'll look like they'll be shuttling around food, innocuous items, but there's a magical obfuscation over them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The ones with the arcane ability look like?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The half-elf and the half-orc are the ones that are magical.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What color is the half-elf's hair?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't remember.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The half-elf is a very short, pointed pixie cut that is ashy blonde.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What was the name of the rogue again?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The rogue is Protto.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Protto.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And I lied, Nott. I used to work with them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is a pretty big matzo ball.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. I'm not proud.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I sort of figured. I figured everyone else figured at this point, really?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I definitely deduced that from our conversation. It's not surprising to me in the least.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I take people at their word.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I do, too. But, you know, people say things.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So we're even Steven.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How bad are the terms that you're on with these people?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Pretty bad!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Want some more booze?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. Shot, shot, shot. Yeah, not great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The spell comes to a close now because you have fulfilled the suggestion.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Ah, you guys are assholes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We told you that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's fair.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We said that multiple times.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can we see if it's them?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, how? Can you go owl it out?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, lay low.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're starting to get a plan.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I plant my hand on Nott's head and go into Frumpkin's eyesight and send him up there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Frumpkin takes off and begins to coast at a fair enough distance to keep an eye down. Make a perception check for Frumpkin with advantage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Advantage, you say?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, he's an owl still. Owl has keen sight and hearing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah! Owl rolls, yeah! 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a figure at each cart. The two larger ones have two horses at each front, the third one has one horse. There is a rider on each of the horses, or at least there is a rider on the smaller horse and there are two that are sitting at the front of the carts that are currently holding onto the reins of the other two. You do see, sitting next to the individual at the reins at the front, a very thick, muscular man, bald with tattoos across the back of his head--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is our fucking guy!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With the glaive resting at the side, staring ahead. Everyone else seems to have hoods up and are trying to keep their image obfuscated.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All but Lorenzo?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Lorenzo, he has a cloak on and stuff, but right now he has the hood back. You really don't see anybody catching their attention. He seems to be enjoying the air across his hairless head.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's good. It's true, shaved head. The wind, it's good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see seven figures.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, in the cages?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's no cages, they're magically--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I assume you communicated all of this to us?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, he usually narrates as he sees.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With his very dulcet tones.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure, this time he does.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sometimes you do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sometimes I do, lately.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We can't attack them like this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why not? There's five of us and--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There's seven of them!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have an owl.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have a plan. It's a bit of a crazy plan. They're carrying the means of their own undoing. If we can free whoever is in those cages, we get a lot of allies.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We don't know if it's your friends.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Anybody in there I'm sure is going to have feelings towards these people.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Look.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we wait until they camp?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I like waiting until they camp and coming in at night.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What were you going to say, Keg?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: When they take people, they break them. So if you're counting on whoever's in those cages to help, they're not going to be able to. It's going to be five versus seven, even if we attack at night.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like mentally break them?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Both.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As far as you know, most of that process happens once they take them back because usually it's a grab and run type scenario. But they do usually have them manacled, hogtied manacle style and gagged.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we can just get into that cage and untie them without them noticing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: At night, maybe after they've camped.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is our best chance because we don't want them to get to their destination because then they are surrounded by many friends.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or a fortress or something.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. Now is the time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we just continue to follow them for now or attack right now in the broad daylight?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How far are they from Shadycreek? You said two days?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About two days, yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two days at your pace, probably three days at theirs.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wait until the sun sets right before they go to sleep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! We know where they're going. We know where they are. Why don't we ride ahead of them--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And set up an ambush?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a damn good idea.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I like that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I could be into that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is wicked.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I wonder if we could do a little bit of both. Free the people in the cage and then ambush later? Nah, that seems distracting.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm sure they're not used to being attacked by people who actually know what they have.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You actually had a good idea for once.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you. I'd better get drunk, then.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's full-speed blow past them, just nod and keep moving.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On the same road? We're not even going to go around?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, wait until they sleep. We're going to follow at a distance and then when they bed down for the night, we leave and then skirt around.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I like this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is a good plan

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well done Nott, well done.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So keeping your distance behind them, pulling your pace back to just the normal, even slow pace, it's up to you. Probably normal to keep in pace with them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: At a medium pace.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was going to happen eventually.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're gross, Marisha.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm the worst.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About a few more hours, sundown hits, we'll say for the purposes of the narrative here. They pull off to the side of the road and begin to set up camp. Keeping an eye on this in the distance, you watch them. Keeping far enough away, making sure you're not in eyeshot of them, as part of that, I will say two of you helm a stealth check to see whether or not they see you on the road behind them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, it'll be the two of you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Helming a stealth check?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why don't you look at that dodec?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I already have it, I just haven't used it yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, it lasts for a day.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I still have it? I don't have it. Oh, but I can look at it again!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Of course you can. This is why I say you shouldn't just hand it over. Just save it for the moment.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought I might have needed it on the thing, but I rolled a natural 20 on my sack check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, you take your fragment of possibility. So... go ahead and roll.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I have to call that I'm going to use advantage on it before or I can roll and then choose?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's afterward. You can roll it and then choose to. It's like a luck point.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't fuck me, Gil. Yeah, it's 20 total.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow, mine's 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispers) Should I do it again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys stay back and watch as they pull off and make camp. With that, as the cover of ever-encroaching night becomes your ally, you begin to arc around on the opposite end of the road going behind one of the larger hill grades, which manages to hide your horses as you speed up and take off ahead. To do this, it's going to cost you an hour of pushing past, so everyone make your constitution saving throws please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that was almost a natural 20, but instead it's five.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You still have your mote, you can use it now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we going to rest on the other side? It lasts a day. Are we going to sleep on the other side?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah? I'm going to save it. Five.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, 18.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so Beau and Caleb, you both take a point of exhaustion. So you're going to have disadvantage on ability checks.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Better constitution than Vax, though.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, interesting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. So, pushing forward on this, you come to a point-- how far ahead of the road of them do you want to set up your ambush?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, we would want them to get going in the morning, right? But not immediately get ambushed, like settle into a little bit of a pace for an hour or two.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's got to be just long enough to where they're zoning out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One hour in. 90 minutes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, somewhere around there. A couple miles.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll stop when we see somewhere that seems advantageous.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, that's the key.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we see something--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, it's dark now, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, but we've got night vision.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 60-foot. Maybe.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Anything that we were going to do would be near the road anyway.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. So who's taking a look for a good ambushing point?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not me, I'm tired.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I will.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So roll for disadvantage because it is night. Even though you have night vision, it's only a short distance.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Perception?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Seven?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, it's a road. So you guys have an evening to-- what do you want to do for your ambush?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We need to plan the ambush.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We need to plan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We don't have a cart to block the road with.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We don't have a cleric who can Hold Person.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do we have?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Just someone with a lot of sordid history with these motherfuckers. Skeletons in the closet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You could stand in the middle of the road and distract them.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's actually not a bad plan, just in case.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Then if we pick a trigger point I could cast Slow... most of them, some of them would make it through unscathed, but--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Would they kill you on sight if they saw you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What if we did like a--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: --like a Red Dawn thing? (laughing) We dug a hole, and then we got in the hole--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You had one good idea.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: --and they came over us and we popped out of the hole and we grabbed onto the cart and we rode under it and then we like chopped a hole in the bottom of the cart.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What does that have to do with the dawn?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It would be really cool!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: First: do we have any dynamite?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! (pause) No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We used it on the troll and it did nothing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's figure out what we do have, though.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We have acid.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have acid.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have four vials of acid.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do we have enough Dispel Magic that we could reveal the cart so we could see it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Dispel Magic?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, like can you make magic go away?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How would that... what?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Magic. Have you never seen anybody do this before? Just make magic go away?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes I can, but what does that have to do with the cart?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're cloaking the cages. You could maybe free the people inside the cages with your magic hand thing that you do. And if their horses die those carts aren't going anywhere.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! We could just kill all the horses.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And then they're stuck.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We may have a split second to-- you want to try to get these people out immediately, that's what you're saying?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If they're out, they're helping us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Horses aren't a big threat, I would rather focus on the people.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But if we kill the horses, the cart can't leave.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, but if we don't kill the people then they can kill us.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's fair, too, but they could try and run.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: These seem like people who are confident in themselves--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They don't run.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was two carts, you said?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Three carts, two larger ones and one smaller.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could just ambush the last one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I couldn't tell from the aerial view, which one-- they're all hidden, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All you saw was just goods in the back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They don't drug their prisoners?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They tie them up and then gag them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They don't drug them?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you have anything we could use?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have an axe and a hammer. And three javelins!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One last question. How secure are these carts, or do they just trust that nobody's going to get out of the hog tie?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They're in cages.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's cage, cage, cage? It's not wooden bottom, wooden top? It's with bars? There's no weak point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You haven't inspected them for weak points, you're not the brightest bulb in the shed necessarily when it comes to these things. They're cages, they're made mostly of metal and they seem to hold. They got locks.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: As long as we can pick some locks, untie some ropes.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think the main-- (heavy sigh)-- The main person to worry about-- so first of all, Protto is the lookout. Disabling him, maybe, if you guys are trying to be stealthy, would be helpful because he's got--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: --we guys.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: "We guys?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're part of the team now too.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We guys. Dwelma is the creepiest and the craziest, she's the half-orc.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Druid.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, she's pretty gnarly. I mean, they're all pretty awful, to be honest.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's our primary goal? Just to stop them and prevent them from fleeing?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: If we're doing this now, we have to kill them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, so we have to stop the path, right? We have to block them from escape. How do we do that? Do we fell a tree? Can we fell a tree?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is a good giveaway, though.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Honestly, once the combat starts, especially if you've got Fireballs, we can just make sure those horses are toast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: it looks like there is a tree stunk-- stunk?-- tree stump and an old rotted tree that's sitting on another one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could fell the tree right on them as they come by.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not a very big tree. If it were to fall it would just hit the side of the hill and be on the side of the road.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How rocky are those hills in between? Could we trigger a rock slide?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, they're not very high, they're maybe seven, ten feet tall at the highest? And it looks like there's been some erosion on the sides where they've just slipped on certain edges.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe using Keg as a distraction up front--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Lorenzo likes to make examples of people. So what would you guys do if I bought you time?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Kill all the horses first so they can't get away?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Couple Fireballs.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I could teleport into one of the cages and start untying people.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh, that's pretty good. I could also Mage Hand and start unlocking cages.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is there a way that we could split them up somehow?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. How do you propose?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Not split them up necessarily, but have each of them occupied.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Have just certain targets between some of us?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All of them, if they are closely grouped. If not, I could hold one person.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If we're trying to split them up, you could just slow the last carriage further down the road and they'd drift apart a bit, I don't know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We could, but the way I would do that would be with a giant, earthen cat paw, which would seem out of the ordinary.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I see.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With you at the top of one hill, if we get you some cover, and you at the other hill, if we give you some cover, giving you both some distance, the three of us getting into the middle of it, coming at them at all sides.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I could stun somebody depending on how close I get. Maybe Lorenzo, try and square off against him. Of course all the spell-slingers are good to take out early as well.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I will say the half-orc has a weird liking for Lorenzo, so just be prepared if he goes down first that she's probably going to go insane.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe we focus on the druid and the sorcerer?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And if we can get a few friends in whoever is in those cages, for all we know that's where they've got our people.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like if you could hold the barbarian, keep the barbarian away... I could maybe stun Lorenzo and focus down on the rogue and the druid.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we have any other weapons or any other special things?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there a way to embed a spell into the ground?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have ball bearings.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Me too.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: On a muddy road, probably not very useful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If they try and climb the hills towards either of you, you can have some ball bearings to help slip them back down.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I stole a gun in the last town we were in. I stole a gun, I have a gun!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to take the gun.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No you're not going to take the gun!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm taking the gun.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No you're not!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm taking the gun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay...?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Dex?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of you make a dexterity check. Well, this would technically be a grapple, so it would be athletics for you--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: --and then it would be athletics or acrobatics for you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh yeah, I'm screwed.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll take acrobatics. It's only 11.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's fine, I'm seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Completely pulled out of your grasp.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does it even have anything in it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm just going to go out and say we're probably going to die, guys.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have rope. Can we set some sort of tripwire trap?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that something you can do? You're good at finding traps. Are you good at setting traps?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: First of all, I'm not good at finding traps, but I've found a few and the ones I've found have been rope based.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: With that big swinging log thing!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I could do a tripwire... for the horses?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's part of me that's wondering if we hid you in the downed tree if you could sneak in and start working on the cages before they even know there's a problem.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They stop to move it. I'm in there, unlocking things.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We send Keg to distract. You go in--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They've already stopped, though.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: --right, but if they try to go around it or something. It's just a tree.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Between two hills.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's the name of this next chapter of our journey, you guys.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Keg goes in to distract, Caleb kills the horses.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, you go in and try and get the people out of the cage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, of course.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But wait, you can't see the cages? They're magically cloaked?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They can't see them, from what you know. From what Keg told you, they're magically cloaked until you get there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're victorious.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we can pick the locks and untie everybody.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am not going to destroy three horses in one shot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, with Slow. Slow.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I thought we talked about horses as well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We don't need to slow the horses. We have a tree. If we want, we have a--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Caleb does the Slow spell on the party. We go in, we kick ass, we win, we're victorious. I just said that 30 seconds ago. Did you guys get it this time?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They come upon a tree and somebody--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you aroused?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They come upon a tree in the road and a woman that they despise now, and that is not suspicious because?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could put her under the tree.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, it is suspicious, but it's distracting.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ah, help, I'm under a tree! Also, you hate me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If you find somebody bleeding under a tree, that's not ridiculous. Tree fell, you happened to get hit. Good luck.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's dumb. Maybe she's standing on the tree and she's like, "I'm a badass with an axe and "a hammer and I took down this tree and now I'm going to take down you."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could put you on top of the tree if you feel like you want to have some words with these people.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nobody is in the road.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm all right with that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We wait until they are just below us. I cast Slow on them, and then we murder them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Then we win, we're victorious. Same plan.

lines.name: SAM, MARISHA
lines.text: Same plan.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll see what happens.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, unless we hear a feasible plan for doing that first--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, okay. Plan A--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I say we kick them in the goolies as hard as we can from the beginning.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If that fails, you're our distraction.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to dig a hole just in case. This Red Dawn thing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm all right for this plan.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Actually, I mean, that is a good idea. Could we spend an-- I'm going to go set my thread across the road. Could you make hiding places for all of us, Nott?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. On the tops of the hills, and then one for me right in the middle of the road under the earth.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do I have a sense of what they would do, were they to reach Shadycreek Run? If they would disband at any point, if they would stick together, where they would take--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, from what your experience would be, they would probably go to the hideout, to their little homestead deeper into the Savalierwood. They would drop off their payload and celebrate, probably, for an evening of revelry, and then come back the next day to begin the process of preparing them for delivery, which involves breaking them.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Presumably, there are people in Shadycreek Run who would love to see them dead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Presumably. There are also people that would--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Would help them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: --would help them. They have allies.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, they're working for one of the tribe families, so yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: NOTT
lines.text: LIAM:I have seen both of you vanish, so if you put in a little bit of time and elbow grease, you can either find places on these two hills that are conducive to us hiding or create those situations with grass or something, I don't know how to do it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, absolutely. Let's do it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's do it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Crafting party.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to tell Frumpkin to go in the sky and watch and head up the road a ways to set that alarm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To set the alarm. Okay. I'm going to pull out the map of the location so you guys can plan out positioning.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, snap.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But you can't know the map because we just came up with this ambush plan tonight. There's no way that you would have foreseen something like this happening.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, the location of hills, if you were to use that one. I have multiple--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If he were human, Sam.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I have multiple maps prepared depending on where things happen.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's a witch, Sam. You know this. He sees the future.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I have multiple maps with different scenarios.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can he float?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He did move four or five maps into this building today under cover of tarp.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Day?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It wasn't that undercover. It was Max going, "No cast is allowed in here for ten "minutes!" It wasn't that stealthy. You weren't here for that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I wasn't.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I walked in the green room at one point, and it was literally the, "No, Mom! Private time!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have a green room?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I was going to say.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's that weird room with the weird hair salon stuff.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, the makeup room.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We should get a mapmaking sock for him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we going to do a studio tour at some point?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We are. We wanted to film it this week, but we got super distracted with building the studio.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know, one of the things about the makeup room is it has those hair salon sinks where you can get a haircut in it or get your hair washed in the sink.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Taliesin wants to get rid of it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I get my hair washed in one of those?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want to so bad.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Anybody who wants me to shave their head, I'll do it.

lines.name: SAM, ASHLEY
lines.text: Ooh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is the scenario that you've found.

lines.name: MARISHA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is the path heading in a north direction. These are the two hills. This is the tree. How would you like to set this up? How do you want to do this?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (indecisive sound) It's less of a tree than I was hoping for.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nott and I look for the best elements of cover.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we move some of those bushes up? Up on top of the hill? Can we snap some twigs and make the bushes bigger?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I could see you probably do something like that, sure. You have a little bit of time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, fluff the bushes a little bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So where are you going to fluff the bushes up here? Like what are you doing? Point it out to me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, let's do that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Here's your paintbrush. Sculpt.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh my god. We're Minecrafting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: About there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm so proud you know what that is.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And we're going to do that over here a little bit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's good. That's good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This thing can't move, right?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We're strong. I'm a beefy boy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can try. You can certainly try.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Should I roll something?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a strength check. This would be athletics, actually. So make it athletics, because this is you, not just lifting it, but also bringing it along.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Holy shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, she's fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You begin to drag it, actually. You watch as this burly dwarf woman with a five-o-clock shadow that is now coming into actual faint stubble grabs it--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's like Rocky IV.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: --begins just dragging it through this big groove in the ground as you pull it over. Where do you want to put it?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is anybody else aroused?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sam Riegel is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You beat me to it. I'm aroused.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we put it here, to narrow the passage?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, that's a good idea.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I like that. Yeah, yeah, yeah. Like that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can also dig a hole right underneath it too so you can hide--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And the shrubberies?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you have this tree here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is this thing hollow at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That tree is actually somewhat hollow. Not completely all the way through, but there is an alcove in it where some of it has rotted out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's where I'll hide. Tomorrow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So Nott, I'll go ahead and mark you as-- this will be where you're hiding, just as a note there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb, any other terraforming we want to do over here?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We want to push the tree over, don't we want to give it a good shove?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: As Caleb comes back from setting the Alarm spell, tell me what you have worked out so far. I set the Alarm spell and I took a wee over that way.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We added some bush up here and up here-- to hide in, so then one person can hide here, one person can maybe hide here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm like, let's do this.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We moved this over and it's got a little nook in it, so Nott can stay in there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's great.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But we have this tree here. Do we want to knock over that tree and block the path?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You have an awesome axe, right?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I do.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Never mind.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That log is good--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I enjoy gilding lilies.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: --and it makes--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How tall is this tree, Matt?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That tree is maybe 15 feet, 20 feet?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So it only--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, that one would be 20 feet tall.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If you come to a road and there's trees along it, your dander goes up. You're on guard.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You would think, there was a tornado that came through here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How about this? If I may. This log that we've set on this side, what if we set it on this side over here--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: --and then we weaken the tree in case we need to tip it over--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. I'm in favor of that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: --and block the other half.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Should I lift again? Or am I just going to-- okay great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That you can do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So now we can weaken this tree, maybe, with some chops and then--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, you can do that angle--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: --it can block the other half.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: --you can do that angle so that you can just hit it and know which side it will fall to--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do I have to roll anything--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can stick a branch in there--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: --to smack it with my axe?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To controlled--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: To controlled smack it with my axe? I'm so powerful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can certainly try.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What do I roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll an athletics check for this one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And Nott's trap making skills for help?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15, okay. So you're able to carve into it, and use your knowledge of where to hit properly and where the strength should be applied, you manage to cut a few wedges into it. It begins to move slightly, and you're like, now's the time to stop.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Nice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Um, just for-- no, that would be too much. I was about to say, I could make a bullshit trip wire, that when the tree went down, it would tighten a rope. It would pop it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hmm.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Interesting.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It would be rope on the ground. I don't know if it would hide in that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, it might be too obvious.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It might be too obvious.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think the best trap we have is Keg standing behind the tree.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's, just for fun, I'm going to have some of our hemp rope already tied around this rock, with just a big mess of it ready to go, so if we need it, we've already got one anchor point.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we want to do any digging? Any mudding? Anything else? Is this our ambush?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where are you going to hide?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Me?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to be in the log, someone's going to be up here in bush one, someone's going to be in bush two.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll be in bush two.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Someone will be behind the tree.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll be behind the tree.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb, where are you going to be?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am going to be way ahead, behind these bushes, because what I'm going to contribute I can do from far away and I can be knocked down like that, so.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Molly, are you taking bush one?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take bush one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so Molly, you're going here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Caleb's going to be all the way back there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beau?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm bush two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bush two here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Beau's going to be here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: These are great codenames.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you're going to be behind the tree?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we have a signal as to when we go? You're going to do the Slow spell, and then we fuck shit up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to have to improvise. If they can all be clumped together for the best, but I'm going to wait and I'm going to call it in the moment, if there's two together and not three, I will go for two. If all three are together, great.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just dry run it here, dry run it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dry running it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. The cart's coming, it gets slowed. "Oh, what the fuck's going on?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It gets slowed when it reaches a log.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, I thought they were coming from the other direction.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, this way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's the north side.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was going to say, either that or you hid up a rock.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you want to tradesies with Molly?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Once the first caravan passes the log.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Then Slow it? But it doesn't stop, it just slows.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does it just slow, not stop?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If it was a Stop spell, it would be called a Stop spell.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The horses will slow, the people will slow.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So right here, it slows. They're like, "What the fuck's going on?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We saw that Lorenzo was in the leading cart, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The leading cart, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How far is your distance?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we want to be a little further.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, so, further.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think we want to try and get the Slow spell off after it's past the log, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're already past us, then. We'll stop them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No! Because I'm here, I'm here, Caleb's here, you're there. Because this will make them funnel, which will gather them for Caleb's spell.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And a row of carts, though, not a group.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It will make for a train, which will not get them all within what I need. Maybe two of them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why don't you tradesies with me, then?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They're still on a road, they're still probably going to go, well. The risk of a straight line of them.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How big were they? Would two, three of them fit in that space?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The carts are about that wide.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How wide is your spell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They'd be going through one at a time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. It's a 40-foot radius?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do we want them to go through one at a time?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is a 40-foot cube.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A cube? I mean, it's a 40-foot cube.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They'll always be in a line.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe. It's dicey. It's right on the cusp, probably, for two or three. Two is better than none, slowed down.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If the front one is slowed down then they're all going to be slowed through there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or we do this, we slow them or whatever, and then--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And now they're ready for a fight.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Then they get here, "Oh, crack!" Or maybe we stop them first, crash, stop, everything stops, then we hit them with Slow.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's great, but they're still in a line.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why would they be in a line? You're just assuming they're going to be in a line instead of clumped together.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's awesome, excuse me, that is fucking wunderbar. That is wunderbar if they were all clumped together, but I'm going to give it a 50/50 chance of them being in a line.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (metal clanging)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, fuck!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Then we should probably wait until they're deeper in, and we can attack them, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They can do less to us if I hit them. But you know, it's not perfect. There's no perfect situation.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So should we let one cart go first, and then?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think so. The second cart in the bottleneck is when we should go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And then we can push the tree on the first cart. That'll be fun.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, that is a lot of fun.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On the first cart?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja, on the first one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: On the first one, you Slow the second one. We attack, we win. Still winning is part of this plan. I just want to make sure that that's clear.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you, Mr. Sheen.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So the first thing that happens is the trunk, the tree.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The second thing that happens is Slow. The third thing that happens is I pop out of the tree trunk--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Look for our friends.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Which cart are they going to be on?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do I know that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have no idea.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Which should I start with? The small one or a big one?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The first one, since it's damaged.
